bug.author: Prikers
bug.summary: False values are interpreted as missing in report
bug.description:
Description With boolean columns, False values are interpreted as missing values. This can be missleading. To Reproduce import pandas as pd from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport
df = pd.DataFrame({'myvar': [True, False, False, True]}) profile = ProfileReport(df) profile.to_file(outputfile='test.html') Result is <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20270441/77002426-c79b3700-695b-11ea-97a3-bfd33f56afa7.png></denchmark-link>
Version information: <denchmark-code>pandas 0.25.3 py37ha925a31_0 defaults pandas-profiling 1.4.1 0 conda-forge </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: This issue is caused by the old version, which can not be reproduced on 2.5.4.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Prikers>@Prikers</denchmark-link> Indeed this issue has been resolved. Is there a specific reason not to update to 2.x.y?
